dsDescriptionValue.value:
The 1995 Latinobarometer is part of an annual survey conducted in Latin American countries. In 1995, 8 countries (Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Mexico, Paraguay, Peru, Uruguay, Venezuela) were surveyed. The
survey measures public opinions, attitudes and behaviors  on topics covering:   Economics and International Trade; Integration and Trade Agreements; Democracy; Politics and Institutions; Civic Culture and Participation; Social Capital; Environment;  and Gender and Gender Discrimination

keywordValue.value: Economics, International Trade, Integration,Democracy, Politics, Political Institutions, Civic Culture, Civic Participation, Social Capital, Environment, Gender, Gender Discrimination

otherGeographicCoverage.value: Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Mexico, Paraguay, Peru, Uruguay, Venezuela
